column4: Contractor Network Management and Scope Expansion
column8: Lets primes import existing subs from Excel
column10:
[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1756932926799019)

> "CUSTOMER FEEDBACK- Customer Feedback: New Image Building Services We just met with New Image Building Services ($20â€“30M) who is supportive of Route and sees clear value for both small and large contractors. While they raised some concerns about our ability to deliver a product (which we addressed), theyâ€™re open to working with us once we go live. Currently, they manage 15â€“20 cleaning and 40+ maintenance subcontractors using Excel and Google Maps, handling 1â€“2 subcontracts monthly across 20 states.All that said, here are some takeaways we need to think through how we take companies like this with their own network of subcontractors, process to manage to these subcontractors and show them our platform is a better tool to BOTH MANAGE and EXPAND their subcontractor network. NOTE: This will open the door for contractors wanting us to add other non-cleaning service type contractors to the platform, e.g. paint, construction, electrical, etc. If we say YES to these additions, we will like get companies to agree to move over, although if we say cleaning only companies in our platform, we will likely get push back as they will not want to manage contractors from two systems.REPLAY LINK BELOW [https://fathom.video/share/oCHf97KySL-NnxqGfWYh98WgjNmtq-qT](https://www.google.com/search?q=https://fathom.video/share/oCHf97KySL-NnxqGfWYh98WgjNmtq-qT)"

column3: Poor Search Results Feedback + Geocoding Fix
column4: Data Sync, Search Feedback, and Geocoding Logic
column8: Alerts team when search yields no matches
column10:
[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1755288027933939)

> "I will start to test the new filters. That said, looks like we loaded all the services to the filter tool. As such, we need to update HubSpot to reflect these options so we are capturing these data points that will feed into Marketplace.Would like to have a button a user can click on that if they get poor results from a given search area, they can send us an alert email that notifying us to place focus on a given area and search needs (does this make sense). Should capture their email so we can reply back after adding/updating database.Please review and advise on the following: If a COMPANY ACCOUNT TYPE in HubSpot is updated, e.g. change from E-CC to another, will it remove from MAP when I sync. Catching a few accounts that are not E-CC (part of a bulk load) and want to make sure not on the map Would like to have a fall back that if a E-CC account does not have an Address 1, the fall back is City, State, Zip/Postal Code and Country will suffice to place a PIN on the map. This is an issue with some of the smaller companies having PO BOXES or NOT WILLING to share physical address. I know we are not ready international although wanted to share we got (as expected) a request from a paying customer to help find three (contractors in Mexico - address below). As I loaded addresses in Hubspot and ran Marketplace Zip lookup and got some really odd results - was hoping the ZIP and COUNTRY have worked, e.g. Mexico 88500 Victoria Mx 87000 Avenida Transformation 101, Parque Industrial Nuevo Santander Reynosa Plant 1 Mx 88500 Carretera Reynosa Matamoros KM,85, Parque Industrial Prologis Tijuana Plant Mx 22000 Calle Saturno No. 309, Fracc. Planetario Reynosa Plant 2 Mx 88500 Ave. Chapultepec Lote 1 Manzana 5 Parque Industrial Colonial
>
> Attached is a link to a document that outlines the key data fields we need to begin collecting from each companyâ€™s Certificate of Insurance (COI). These fields will eventually become searchable within Marketplace. The long-term vision is twofold: Policy Management & Reminders Weâ€™ll automate notifications for upcoming COI renewalsâ€”alerting both the contractor (at 90, 60, and 30 days out) and the PRIME (at 15 days out and again on the expiration date, if no update has been made). This ensures better compliance and fewer surprises across all subcontractor relationships. Insurance Optimization & Revenue Opportunities By analyzing this data, weâ€™ll be able to flag when a contractor may be over- or under-insuredâ€”helping them "rightsize" their coverage to match the scale of their business. Additionally, by capturing the insurance carrier name and expiration date, we create a window of opportunity to collaborate with our insurance partnersâ€”enabling us to:Offer early outreach and support to help contractors secure the best-fit policies. Generate dual revenue streams through both access to carrier/expiration data and recurring commissions from successfully closed insurance opportunities. Overall, have to believe thereâ€™s a strong opportunity to leverage OCR or AI technology to scan uploaded COIs and auto-populate or update the required data fields. This would streamline the process significantly and ensure accuracy at scale.Let me know if you have any questions as you review the document.[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1D8GPOMz_3Ro3-YGxrkbG3S6yDeI7Y3ow/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=114154587924383815728&rtpof=true&sd=true](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1D8GPOMz_3Ro3-YGxrkbG3S6yDeI7Y3ow/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=114154587924383815728&rtpof=true&sd=true)"

column3: Show Service Radius in Miles + Kilometers
column4: Display Service Radius in Miles and Kilometers
column8: Prepares platform for international expansion
column10:
[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1759174277510249)

> "REMINDER:SERVICE RADIUS up to 50 Miles / 80.46 km any request >50 Miles / 80.46 km needs to BOOK AN APPOINTMENT --- booking link >>[https://meetings.hubspot.com/cleanjack/route-onboarding-training-callAlso](https://meetings.hubspot.com/cleanjack/route-onboarding-training-callAlso), can we make the miles displayed such we are starting to incorporate km? e.g.1 Mile / 1.61 km 2 Miles / 3.22 km 3 Miles / 4.82 km 4 Miles / 6.44 km etc,
>
> Carly
>
> Sep 29th at 2:32 PM Does it matter that a lot of the people filling out the waitlist posted 100miles service radius?
>
> Jack Ellison
>
> Sep 29th at 2:47 PM yes matters. Of the 510 Waitlist accounts, 26 are 100 miles (5.1%), 10 are 75 miles (1.9%), 19 are 50 miles (3.7%) and the remaining 89% are 25 Miles. 50 Miles is a good number to warrant a follow-up conversation as my concern is smaller companies will want to say they are actually servicing further than they can and we will be making recommendations that will create service issues.
>
> Bill Basil
>
> Sep 29th at 3:59 PM I have similar concerns as Jack here too. Smaller companies could think aggressively vs strategically in an effort to win business they may not be able to handle.With that being said, a phone call or meeting with every company isnt scalable, esp once weâ€™re really cookin. I would suggest that we create some sort of help icon or blocker at this stage so people understand more doesnt always mean better, accuracy is highly recommended for the best experience.
>
> Jack Ellison
>
> Sep 29th at 4:07 PM @Bill Basil 50 miles can be entered without issue so no bottleneck here. The link to set up a follow-up call will be week out those that are stretching their service area, e.g. >70% follow-up calls will never be booked as they know they are stretching. The 30% that do book a call, we want to talk to as they likely have more branch offices (parent/sub conversation), coaching/mentorship opportunities and will ultimately we want to increase the option/flexibility to increase subscription price the more markets a company is visible.
>
> Bill Basil
>
> Sep 29th at 4:36 PM Lets chat on this more Jack. I think weâ€™re onto something here, weâ€™ll flush out some ideas."

column8: Tracks ISNetworld approval for CBRE-type clients
column10:
[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1759270423417879)

> "working on a project via KleenMark and CBRE (Real Estate Management Company) who is KleenMark's customer ask their vendors they work with PRIME and SUB be approved via ISN (see below). Not sure if this is or is not a requirement, although Mike with KleenMark is asking for us to know if they are. Log this feedback as we will may need to have an section for this requirement (if it is a requirement)ISN is a software company providing solutions for vendor risk, contractor management, and other compliance-related services; CBRE is the world's largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, with offerings in leasing, property management, investment, and development. While they are separate entities, CBRE uses its own internal technology solutions and data platforms to serve its clients in managing real estate portfolios and transactions. There is no inherent connection or common ownership between the ISN software and CBRE's real estate business.[https://www.isnetworld.com/en/customers/contractors-suppliers](https://www.isnetworld.com/en/customers/contractors-suppliers)"

column4: Opportunity Data, Import & UI Sync MVP
column8: Aligns required fields across all input methods
column10:
[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1759931339787459)

[https://www.loom.com/share/096153ed2e8442a0a44976b37ce46ba2?sid=b6a734f9-f0ee-4ae5-a590-b1cc50cbf1c2](https://www.loom.com/share/096153ed2e8442a0a44976b37ce46ba2?sid=b6a734f9-f0ee-4ae5-a590-b1cc50cbf1c2)

"I provided on this channel what I feel is worthwhile MVP as well as Parking Lot Feedback (combo of video and text above), although as mentioned not sure what is and is not making it to the MVP TO DO LIST or added to the PARKING LOT. While I know focus on MVP is top priority, it would be convenient for all of us to see the growing list so 1) we are collectively not sending duplicate feedback and 2) in some cases I may want to have a convo on something that was moved to parking lot that should be discussed as part of MVP. All that said, I am happy to help where I can.I re-reviewed my feedback above and listed below is some of the feedback provided that I feel should be included in the MVP. If after reviewing you have questions or need reasoning around why it should be included in the MVP, happy to quick connect to explain why. Add the following data fields to Opportunity Location capture - Import CSV, Batch ZIP and Single Additions

> Opportunity Type (Recurring Service or One-Time Service) - \*\*POST MVP IS FINE ALTHOUGH WANT TO DISCUSS WHY ASK AND SEGMENT OPPORTUNITIES Opportunity Status (Active Opportunity vs Potential Opportunity) Active = Prime Has Been Awarded Biz vs Potential = Prime is working to secure biz) \*URGENCY CONVO Total Cleanable Area (renaming - need contractors thinking cleanable not total sq ft) Service Frequency Service Window (Times) Scope Of Work (attachment in dedicated section - clear on summary page) Scope Of Work Addendum - Additions/Subtractions To Master Scope Of Work By Location If Applicable (attachment in dedicated section - clear on summary page) Tag Work Opportunities (Yes, No, Potential) Opportunity Duration (# Months or One Time Project) Service Start Date (Target) \*I noticed the data being collected between Batch ZIP and Manual Add is not in sync, e.g. 1) Batch Add is saying Facility Type and Services are optional whereas they are required in Manual Add , 2) Location Name and sq ft is missing on Batch Add and 3) should add a placeholder for Batch Add with U.S. being default. Someone needs to review each of these as they should be 100% in sync. The IMPORT CSV > rewatch [https://www.loom.com/share/096153ed2e8442a0a44976b37ce46ba2?sid=b6a734f9-f0ee-4ae5-a590-b1cc50cbf1c2](https://www.loom.com/share/096153ed2e8442a0a44976b37ce46ba2?sid=b6a734f9-f0ee-4ae5-a590-b1cc50cbf1c2) Some of the takeways ---a) Upload & Analyze Button vs Import & Geocode is not clear at start, b) Import & Geocode is likely too much info -- just IMPORT, and c) Import button is not easily found (very bottom and to the far right of a not full screen).OVERALL: THE FEEDBACK HAS BEEN WE NEED TO MAKE THIS PROCESS QUICK WHICH I AGREE WITH ALTHOUGH KEEP IN MIND WE HAVE TO LOOK AT THE OVERALL PROCESS/TIME AND NOT JUST A STEP, e.g. WE ARE REDUCING OVER 80% OF THE TIME INVOLVED IN THE ENTIRE PROCESS VIA THE SEARCH/FIND FUNCTIONALITY WHICH IS A HUGE WIN AND SHOULD BE SOMETHING WE COMMUNICATE. ALSO KEEP IN MIND THAT LEAVING OUT KEY ELEMENTS LISTED ABOVE IS GOING TO ADD MORE TIME TO A PROJECT AS CONTRACTORS (ON BOTH SIDES) ARE GOING TO HAVE TO STOP AND ASK/ANSWER QUESTIONS WE KNOW THEY ARE GOING TO ASK - SO WHY MAKE THEM ASK AND ADD TIME TO A PROJECT.2. The Opportunity Description should not be where we add scope of work. This should field just be a high level overview of the project and Scope of Work should be an attachment3. Incorporate An Opportunity Import Template to set standard around ideal data to be collected. Provided the following in prior feedback and discussed on weekly progress and feedback calls. [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1JvqFkFFXeRk078PxrzA74LH2qzXGtQZC/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=114154587924383815728&rtpof=true&sd=true4](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1JvqFkFFXeRk078PxrzA74LH2qzXGtQZC/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=114154587924383815728&rtpof=true&sd=true4). OpportunitiesAll Opportunities Summary Page: Can we assign a unique Route # to each Opportunity so everyone haas a clear reference number as start we start to build volume, e.g. ROU-XXXXXXX. Suggest that if an update is made to an Opportunity, we signal this updated via a suffix at the end of the number, e.g. ROU-1234.03 tells us this is Route Exchange Opportunity 1234 version 35. Settings >Profile (Team Member) Add Telephone and Cell Number -- IMPORTANT: We have to be clear on these data fields for SMS purposes, e.g. if we are just capturing Phone and not sure if it is Phone (land line) or Cell, we will not know what number we should use for SMS campaignsTeam Add Last Active Date (if the screen has to scroll right to left to view more data, that is fine - perhaps make Name Column static and other data fields slide) Add CellCompany Where is this on the staging, e.g. able to update/edit Company Settings, Add New Branches/Satellite Offices? Even if a user does not have the ability to edit, they should be able to see what it communicates (another layer of eyes looking at it and making recommendations to ADMIN)Credentials Rework the top header that reads "Build trust with potential clients through verification and Route + ISSA certification program". This section is more than ISSA and ISSA should only be highlighted in areas they are relevant.We use the word Verified in the Route Verification section. Who is verifying? Maybe not the right word to use?Rework the sub header under - Route Verification section, e.g. "Verify your company identity to build trust with potential clients" should be more about your business being business readyShould have the ability to quick view and download any documents that are captured in this section --6. SubcontractorsFor this section, we are searching Contractors for Subcontract Opportunities. As such, recommend we rename Contractors as no need to call one a Prime or Subcontractor if searching.How does the Active Searches work? 1) There is no way to add multiple zip codes and search filters and 2) no name, save, crated by and share buttonHow does the Favorites work? Think should be a better name than Favorites. Also, see feedback in this channel on the need to and how to classify these companies."

column10:
[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1758207452173839)

> "ADD TO PARKING LOT: As we go deeper into each respective company via coaching, sales, marketing, accounts payable, etc. we have a growing number of contacts we are capturing for each of these companies. I am assuming these contacts within HubSpot will eventually make it over to Route Marketplace or vice versa. To that end, each of these contacts will have 1) unique profiles on if/when/where their contact info is shared within Route Marketplace and 2) the email notices they should/need to receive.For example, a primary sale contact for a company needs to have their information shared in the company profile although there are 2 other sales contacts within the company. that may or may not need to be listed On the reverse side each of these three sales contacts want to be alerted to sales opportunity, although the president, director of marketing, accounts payables lead will not need to get these notices although they would like to be made aware of live events we are hosting, platform updates, etc. In short lots of communications variables. Sending this feedback over as would like to make it a topic when time is right. Keep in mind we will need to consider if/when/how C&C, TJS, MHCB also play into this profile set up under TEAM PROFILE and/or individual PROFILE."

column10:
[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1758129743729019)

> "Based on verbal Jan-Pro provided today, they are going to have over 100 branches within Marketplace. As such, their company/branch profiles will likely be very close to the same in each market and they MAY have 2-3 contacts within their corporate office which manages the inbound opportunities to these 100 branches. Still to be determine and will include you on the planning call once we get to this point, although I can see a need for the ability to copy and paste a company profile to other branches within the same company. No action requested, although something to begin thinking about, e.g. Pinch is another account that will need this too and is active in Marketplace now.
>
> . What does a â€œbranchâ€ mean in this context @Jack Ellison ? (edited)
>
> They have a HQ Corporate office and xxx satellite offices across the U.S. This ties back to parent/child and admin discussions we have had in the past too, e.g. corporate has the ability to set up and manage who has access, what they see, connection of teams on projects between branches/satellite offices. Not asking we solve for MVP although will be a topic of conversation as we get more of the larger national players onboard.
>
> Ernesto
>
> 12:29 PM Agreed.But do the satellite offices matter?
>
> 12:29 If the contract has services area and contract details why do the satÃ©lite offices matter?
>
> Jack Ellison
>
> 12:31 PM They are looking to utilize as both a prime, a sub and eventually leads. If they are a sub or are looking for leads, you have to put the satellite offices on a map so they come up in a search
>
> Ernesto
>
> 12:34 PM Agreed. But it would be on a case by case basis because not all satellite offices will sub at any given point.
>
> Jack Ellison
>
> 12:36 PM Set up a call with you me, Ricardo as better live discussion.
>
> Ernesto
>
> 12:38 PM Would be extremely helpful to keep on this thread.
>
> 12:38 Weâ€™re not acting on this right away so slack should be good for now until after launch
>
> Jack Ellison
>
> 12:40 PM We will be adding Jan Pro to the Marketplace map --- all 100+ branches/satellite offices. If we do not have the branch/satellite offices set up with their profile, service area, how will Jan Pro be included and found by Primes? Eventually see leads?
>
> Ernesto
>
> 12:44 PM Is Jan pro engaging primarily as a prime or sub with the current convo we have?
>
> 12:46 I assume we sold white glove service?
>
> Jack Ellison
>
> 12:47 PM BOTH PRIME / SUB role as will be the case with many multi branch/satelite offices accounts. EVERYTHING we are signing now is Founding Partner/White Glove. (edited)
>
> Jack Ellison
>
> 12:48 PM Stopping conversation for now. This is a WIN and will pull you back in once we have kick off call scheduled. Just take my notes and add them to the board please as it is a placeholder for now."

column4: Contractor Vetting Data Fields and Vetting Questions
column8: Captures retention rates; ownership structure; QA programs
column10:
[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1758225237249429)

> "@Ernesto feedback from KleenMark on key data fields they want to know when vetting a new contractor. Placed an next to those we have in progresss/on our radar and next to those we may want to consider. I have added in ALL CAPS additional notes. SEE ATTACHED DOCUMENT. Client retention 85% or betters THIS IS A GREAT QUESTION ALTHOUGH ONE THAT IS HARD TO VALIDATE (TRUST FACTOR). NEED TO PUT TIME FRAMES ON THE QUESTION TO SHOW TRENDS, e.g. 1 YEAR, 2 YEAR, 3 YEAR
>
> Employee retention or if you want to look at it as a turnover, we want that number to be less than 75% annually. THIS IS A GREAT QUESTION ALTHOUGH ONE THAT IS HARD TO VALIDATE (TRUST FACTOR).
>
> Private companies, of course. THIS IS A GOOD SEARCH FILTER EVENTUALLY WHEN WE OPEN UP TO OWNERS/MANAGERS AND IS MORE THAN SIMPLE YES/NO QUESTION AS SOME COMPANIES ARE PRIVATE WITH PRIVATE EQUITY BEHIND THEM, SO QUESTION & OPTIONS MAY BEQuestion: What best describes your companyâ€™s ownership structure? Options: Private (100% privately owned) Public (100% publicly traded) Mixed â€“ Combination of private and public ownership If mixed, please indicate approximate percentage privately held: \___\_ %
>
> Desirable revenue 2 - 20mm
>
> Must purchase through us all chemical, product, and equipment. THIS WOULD BE SOMETHING ADDED IN SCOPE OF WORK AND NOT A SEARCH CRITERIA
>
> More states the better:)
>
> Certification third-party.
>
> Multi vertical - Commercial only. No residential. - NO ISSUES AS SMALLER ACCOUNTS THEY WILL BE FINE IF THEY HAVE TO USE RESIDENTIAL CLEANERS THAT KNOW COMMERCIAL
>
> Must stay here to keep performance indicators if we are subcontracting versus referring.
>
> Quality assurance program. THIS WOULD BE MORE A QUESTION IF THEY HAVE/UTILIZE (YES/NO) AND WHAT TOOLS DO THEY USE (DROP DOWN WITH KNOWN SaaS OPTIONS WITH MANUAL FORMS BEING THE TOP OPTION.
>
> Safety mod rate below 1. THIS IS THE EMR Score that keeps coming up that would be uploaded with COI (edited)"

column8: Apple Watch-style visual to encourage completion
column10:
[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1754344126614949)

> 1. Registered vs. Unregistered Accounts Add a visual indicator (e.g., color shading or icon) to easily distinguish between registered and unregistered Eâ€‘CC accounts in Marketplace. Make this status a filterable field in both Marketplace and HubSpot to support segmentation and marketing outreach. This will help us push opportunities to registered users and better target unregistered accounts for follow-up and conversion campaigns.
> 2. Profile Completion Status Display the percentage of profile completion on each accountâ€™s profile card (e.g., â€œProfile 62% Completeâ€). This metric should be publicly visible to apply indirect social pressure on account owners to finish completing their profile. For a more engaging visual element, consider using a circular progress ring similar to the Apple Watch activity tracker:25% complete = quarter ring filled 50% complete = half ring filled 75% complete = three-quarter ring filled 100% = full ring Objective Encourage full registration and profile completion by making both status and progress visible and filterable. Prioritize sharing opportunities with registered accounts while nudging unregistered users to take action.
>
> Ernesto Â Â 4:55 PM 1Â -Â makes sense 2Â -Â Iâ€™ll add to backlog but not immediately convinced itâ€™s an MvP must have.Profile completion should be incentivized by the ability to see more info on partially available contract info until they complete the profile.Â Â (edited)Â 
>
> Any request I submit are for logging and initial prioritizing. We can assign and where applicable discuss priority level once we start to see the requests in a centralized location.Â  It should be noted, the heavy lift we will soon be facing is getting contractors to 1) create an account and 2) complete their profile so that we are dialing in strong recommendations quickly.Â  Currently we can find the contractors in an area quickly although are not sure they are a good match as we are lacking their profile data.Â  Lastly, this filtering in Marketplace and HubSpot will make it easier to market to those that have and have not registered for an account (two different messages).Â  Thanks
>
> Ernesto Â Â Aug 4th at 5:06 PM Can you clarify what you mean by "dialing in strong recommendations"?
>
> Jack Ellison Â Â Aug 4th at 5:14 PM Sure a contractor comes to us and advises they need a contractor in zip code 06103 which is meets the following search filter A, B, C, D, E.Â  The more we push for 100% profile completion which includes profile data we ask for during the registration as well as the supplemental profile data, e.g. expanded Industries, Account Types, Ratings, Associations, Certifications, etc. we will begin to collect, the quicker we get to providing stronger first time recommendations and opportunities for those contractors completing their profiles.Â  KEEP IN MIND: On the reverse side, we will also be able to advise contractors why they are potentially missing opportunities (not being found in a search/filter) due to an incomplete profile or not having a particular qualifying filter search a customer is searching for, e.g. not ISSA member, not able to provide solar panel cleaning, does not provide medical cleaning services.
>
> Jack Ellison Â Â Aug 4th at 5:27 PM as you take all this in, I feel think our average subcontract search (filter) for the next six months will be between 12-25 locations per project, which means we are being asked to deliver to a Prime (depending on the density of the market) around 3-5 subcontractor options per location (zip code) - so the ability for us to help "dial in" strong initial suggestions based on "fuller" profile data is key to keeping the total number of companies they have to vet, answer FAQ, negotiate with, etc. will be key to driving our value and price point.Â  Right now we are having to recommending 5-8 potential contractors as we have no profile data other than zip, thus they need to vet (in the case of 12-25 locations per project estimate above) anywhere between 60-200 companies.Â Â  Let me know if this does not make sense.
>
> Ernesto Â Â Aug 5th at 2:19 PM I think the profile being a core driver and flywheel of the experience is an obvious mechanic for the product team. 2:20 The mindset we should have is that people will not trust us and will need to beÂ subtlyÂ andÂ organicallyÂ show reasons to complete a profile. 2:20 Assume the users do not trust us. 2:20 Assume the users don't have time to fill out the information 2:21 Assume the users don't even want our help because they're already busy enough with their business.Â (edited)Â  2:21 We should build an experience that is mindful of this, and gradually gains the trust of the users to incrementally provide the right information at the right time.

> Please add to the Route Dictionary the following words which we will need to make sure we are using correctly in our communications and profiles, e.g. 1099 Independent Contractors are not employees and when we ask or discuss employee count, we need to keep these numbers separate to help contractors reinforce the clear difference between the two. That said, we can use the word TOTAL WORKFORCE which refers to all individuals engaged in work for a company, regardless of employment type. This includes full-time and part-time W-2 employees, as well as 1099 independent contractors, subcontractors, and temporary staff.W-2 Employees: W-2 employees are individuals who work directly for a company and receive wages reported on IRS Form W-2. They are on the companyâ€™s payroll, with taxes (income tax, Social Security, Medicare) withheld by the employer.1099 Independent Contractors: 1099 independent contractors are self-employed individuals or businesses that provide services to a company under a contractual agreement. Unlike W-2 employees, they are not on the companyâ€™s payrollâ€”they are responsible for paying their own income taxes, Social Security, and Medicare, and they do not receive employee benefits.

column8: Nurtures hesitant subs with opportunity alerts
column10:
## ðŸ’¡ Feature Request Idea Summary

* The feature requests adding a third option, **"Maybe (Open To Review Opportunities)"**, to the existing "Open To Subcontract Opportunities" field for contractors. 
* The goal is to avoid closing the door completely on contractors who are hesitant to engage in subcontracting due to past negative experiences. 
* This "Maybe" status allows them to receive opportunity alerts, providing market insight and business intelligence, and encourages them to consider opportunities on a case-by-case basis. The intent is to nurture contractors and keep them engaged with the platform.

### 2\. User Story

* As a **Sales/Onboarding Team Member**, 
* I want to **set a contractor's subcontracting preference to "Maybe (Open To Review Opportunities)"** 
* so that **I can nurture hesitant contractors by keeping them engaged with relevant opportunity alerts and eventually convert them to "Yes."**

### 3\. Acceptance Criteria (AC)

* The "Open To Subcontract Opportunities" field on the contractor profile/settings must include the following three selectable options for the user:
  * **Yes**
  * **No**
  * **Maybe (Open To Review Opportunities)**
* The selected option must be successfully saved to the backend system upon form submission.
* The backend alert system must include all companies where the "Open To Subcontract Opportunities" field is set to **"Yes"** OR **"Maybe (Open To Review Opportunities)"** in the distribution list for subcontract opportunity alerts.
* Companies selecting **"No"** must be excluded from receiving these opportunity alerts.

---

## Open Questions for the Product Team

* **Data Field Name/Value:** What is the precise backend field name and the associated value for the "Maybe (Open To Review Opportunities)" option? (e.g., `is_open_to_subcontract: 'maybe'`).
* **System of Record:** Is this preference field being implemented in the new "Exchange" platform, or is this an update to an existing system like HubSpot?
* **"Maybe" Field Value Persistence:** Does the "Maybe" preference persist indefinitely, or is there an intention to set an expiration date or require re-confirmation after a certain period (e.g., 6 months) to ensure the preference is still accurate?
* **Alert Customization:** For the MVP, should the content, format, or frequency of the alerts be identical for both "Yes" and "Maybe" users?

[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1761080774314169)

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/80ab0ef7-50e3-4a06-bade-2a91fe571f79/f9d495dd-1103-47ca-b795-4648c7e768d8/1247c21a-dc07-4a73-9691-d475e320dc19)

column8: Dynamically requires fields based on state (e.g. CA training)
column10:
## ðŸ’¡ Feature Request Idea Summary

* The system needs to **dynamically adjust required form fields** on a user's profile based on the state they select, addressing state-specific compliance mandates.
* This adjustment should happen during the **profile creation/info input flow** for service partners.
* This feature aims to move the existing process out of the current "Chat section" and into a structured data collection flow, starting post-ISSA.

# User Story

* As a **Service Partner User**,
* I want the **profile input flow** to dynamically mark fields like 'Business License' or 'Training Certification' as **MANDATORY** based on the selected state,
* so that I am **guided to complete all state-mandated compliance requirements** and maintain a certified profile.

## **Acceptance Criteria (AC)**

* The user must be prompted to select the primary state of operation during the profile input/claiming flow.
* Upon selecting a state (e.g., California), specific related fields (e.g., Sexual Assault Training Certificate, Business License Number) must **immediately change from optional to mandated**.
* Mandatory fields must be visually indicated as required (e.g., with an asterisk $\*$).
* The user must be **prevented from submitting** their profile or advancing the flow until all state-mandated fields are complete and valid.
* If the user selects a state with no known mandates (e.g., State X), the fields must remain **optional**.

### 

[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1762452962554959)

> hey team, coming out of signatory council meetings for service partner certification, there are a couple things that keep coming up that i wanted to toss out for consideration --
>
> 1. State by state needs related to business licenses
>    1. example: some states require business license, some states its optional to have.
> 2. state by state needs related to compliance
>    1. example: california requires sexual assault training.Â 
>
> 
> can/should we consider these statewide mandates?Â  the flow would be during info input/claiming profile flow, the user selects the state and certain form fields/elements transition to MANDATED instead of optional??

column8: 1-5 star ratings with half increments and counter-responses
column10:
# ðŸ’¡ Feature Request Idea Summary

* Allow **internal users** (PRIME/SUBCONTRACTOR) to request and submit structured feedback/ratings on their collaborative work, possibly tied to a Quarterly Business Review (QBR) cycle.
* The feedback mechanism must use a **1-5 star rating** system with half-star increments and include a mandatory text **feedback field** for each question.
* All ratings and reviews must be viewable in a **detailed summary** that includes aggregation, filtering (e.g., date range, score), and **transparent counter-responses** while keeping the identities of the PRIME/SUBCONTRACTOR who rated them visible *only* to each other.

---

## User Story

* As a **PRIME or SUBCONTRACTOR user**,
* I want to **initiate, submit, and view structured, aggregated, and filterable ratings and reviews** for partnership opportunities with appropriate transparency and access controls,
* so that **performance is officially tracked, analyzed over time, and openly discussed** between the involved parties without public exposure of the partnership details.

## **Acceptance Criteria (AC)**

* The system must allow a user to initiate a rating/review for an active opportunity after a defined period (e.g., related to a QBR cycle).
* The rating form must require a **1-5 star rating** with **half-star increments** (1.0, 1.5, 2.0, etc.) and a **mandatory feedback field** for each question.
* The system must automatically calculate and display an **overall star rating** upon completion of the review.
* A dedicated dashboard must display submitted ratings and reviews individually and as an **aggregated summary**.
* The summary must include filtering options by **date range** (e.g., Past 6 Months, Past Year), **score** (e.g., highest to lowest), and **chronology** (e.g., newest to oldest).
* Users must be able to **submit a counter-response** to any submitted review.
* All submitted feedback and counter-responses must be visible and transparent to platform users.
* **Access Control:** The identity of the **PRIME and SUBCONTRACTOR** involved in a specific review must **only be visible to those two involved parties**; all other users must see an anonymized view.

[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1763550444675709)

> Please add this RATINGS/REVIEW solution feedback as a placeholder on the roadmap and prioritization summary.Â  Focus on Row 1-22 with suggested platform to review.Â Â  [https://www.getfeedback.com/en/](https://www.getfeedback.com/en/)
> As far as timing of the ratings/reviews, we need 1) to allow some time to pass and engagement/work to occur before actively requesting feedback (I am thinking we use QBR - Quarterly Business Reviews Reminder to spur this feedback by active opportunity), 2) for each question we need a 1-5 star rating with 1/2 star integrals with feedback fields for each question - at the end of each rating review the data enter will produce an overall start rating.Â  The ratings/reviews will be viewable individually but also aggregated to provide a summary with filters, e.g. newest to oldest, highest to lowest, Past 6 Month, Past Year, Past 3 years, etcÂ  and 3) we have to be transparent with the feedback and any counter responses although we do not want to share publicly the PRIMES and the SUBCONTRACTORS working together - this was a clear takeaway from ISSA (behind the scenes the PRIME and SUBCONTRACTOR will see who is rating and reviewing them).
> [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1sSRvCrIuW9udsDP8--0ht4WQocliYJAB/edit?gid=1351795087#gid=1351795087](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1sSRvCrIuW9udsDP8--0ht4WQocliYJAB/edit?gid=1351795087#gid=1351795087)

column8: Lets primes bookmark trusted subs for future use
column10:
## ðŸ’¡ Feature Request Idea Summary

* The platform currently lacks the ability for a Prime Contractor to **save a Subcontractor as a "Favorite"**.
* This feature is needed to **streamline the process** of re-engaging trusted subcontractors for future opportunities.
* This is especially important for users like Rozalado, who manage a network of reliable subcontractors.

---

## User Story

As a **Prime Contractor**, I want to be able to **designate a Subcontractor as a "Favorite"** from their company profile or search results, so that I can **easily filter, find, and select them** for future opportunities.

## Acceptance Criteria

* A distinct **"Favorite" icon/button** (e.g., a star or heart) must be visible on the Subcontractor's profile page and in the Subcontractor search results list.
* A Prime Contractor must be able to **toggle the "Favorite" status** on and off for any Subcontractor.
* Subcontractors are **not notified** when they are designated as a favorite by a Prime Contractor.
* The Prime Contractor's **Subcontractor Search** feature includes a **filter option** to display **only "Favorite" Subcontractors**.
* On the Subcontractor search results page, **Favorite Subcontractors must be visually highlighted or prioritized** (e.g., appearing at the top of the search results).

[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1763823571873199)

> I thought we had in the MVP the ability to SAVE favorite Contractors.Â  Not seeing it as was looking to add Rozalado's subs to this favorites to see how it worked.Â  Please advise.

column4: Exchange Network Dashboard for Prime Contractors
column8: Filterable grid view of all subcontractor data
column10:
## ðŸ’¡ Feature Request Idea Summary

* The core request is to **design and build a comprehensive "Exchange Network Dashboard"** for Prime Contractors to manage and filter a large number of Subcontractor profiles.
* The dashboard requires a **specific set of data fields** to be displayed for each contractor, including company metrics, service capabilities, and utilization data (W-2/1099).
* The dashboard must include robust **filtering capabilities** based on these key data fields to support granular search and selection.

## User Story

As a **Prime Contractor**, I want a **searchable and filterable Exchange Network Dashboard** that displays **all critical subcontractor data fields in a customizable grid view**, so that I can **efficiently assess and select the most qualified subcontractors** from a large pool based on multiple criteria and perspectives.

## Acceptance Criteria

* **Dashboard Structure:** The dashboard presents Subcontractor data in a **tabular/grid layout** where each row is a company and each column is a data field (matching the spreadsheet structure).
* **Data Fields Displayed:** The dashboard must display (as columns) the key data fields outlined in the provided spreadsheet (e.g., Company Name, Location, **Company Size (W-2 Employees)**, **Subcontractor (1099) Companies**, **Percentage Of Work Subcontracted**, Insurance Liability Limit, Services Provided, etc.).
* **Filtering Capability:** The user must be able to **filter the list** based on all critical data fields, including, but not limited to:
  * **Location** (City/State/ZIP Code/Radius)
  * **Service Type** (Multi-select)
  * **Insurance Liability Limit** (Range filter: e.g., $\\ge \\$2M$)
  * **W-2 / 1099 Data** (Range filters on W-2 Employee Size and Percentage Of Work Subcontracted)
* **Sorting and Customization:** The Prime Contractor must be able to **sort the dashboard results** by any column header (e.g., by Location, W-2 Size, etc.) and **customize which columns are visible**.
* **Actionable Items:** Each Subcontractor row must include an **actionable link/button** to view the full profile and/or initiate contact/bidding.

[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1763918276006669?thread_ts=1763823571.873199&cid=C098HEHN2HL)

> See below on how I envision the finally EXCHANGE NETWORK DASHBOARD looking/working, e.g. data points shared and filtering ability.Â  I have utilized platforms like this in the past and found this as the easiest way to view large amounts of data from multiple views/perspectives.
> KEY DATA FIELDS/LAYOUT [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1NquKpZ41PdeXWaLovAy5mfjHOW2gFlfK/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=114154587924383815728&rtpof=true&sd=true](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1NquKpZ41PdeXWaLovAy5mfjHOW2gFlfK/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=114154587924383815728&rtpof=true&sd=true)

column4: Add a ICON/Tool that allows for quick OPEN 24 Hours Day
column8: One-click sets bid deadline to 24 hours from now
column10:
## ðŸ’¡ Feature Request Idea Summary

* The user needs a dedicated **tool or icon** to facilitate the creation of an opportunity that is **open for bidding for 24 hours**.
* This tool should be easily accessible, suggesting a **quick-action button** or similar UI element.
* The goal is to streamline the process for rapidly soliciting bids for time-sensitive needs.

## User Story

As an **Opportunity Creator (Prime Contractor)**, I want a **dedicated "Quick 24-Hour" button** on the opportunity creation screen, so that I can **instantly set the bidding window to close after exactly 24 hours** without manually adjusting the time/date.

## Acceptance Criteria

* A new, clearly labeled **ICON/Tool/Button** (e.g., "24-Hour Quick Bid" or clock icon) is added to the Opportunity Creation flow.
* When the user clicks this button, the system **automatically populates the bidding end date/time** to be exactly **24 hours from the current time** (or the time the opportunity is published/made live).
* Clicking the quick-action button must **overwrite any manually entered closing date/time**.
* The user must still have the **ability to manually adjust** the closing date/time after clicking the 24-hour button.

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/80ab0ef7-50e3-4a06-bade-2a91fe571f79/df7a83aa-240b-47be-816c-415ff7bfcbe8/8050e67f-3ccf-4514-bae3-8c9f9b0ea7f2)

> "@Mitesh Shah @Om @Willow Kowalski Attached is a link to a document that outlines the key data fields we need to begin collecting from each companyâ€™s Certificate of Insurance (COI). These fields will eventually become searchable within Marketplace. The long-term vision is twofold: Policy Management & Reminders Weâ€™ll automate notifications for upcoming COI renewalsâ€”alerting both the contractor (at 90, 60, and 30 days out) and the PRIME (at 15 days out and again on the expiration date, if no update has been made). This ensures better compliance and fewer surprises across all subcontractor relationships. Insurance Optimization & Revenue Opportunities By analyzing this data, weâ€™ll be able to flag when a contractor may be over- or under-insuredâ€”helping them "rightsize" their coverage to match the scale of their business. Additionally, by capturing the insurance carrier name and expiration date, we create a window of opportunity to collaborate with our insurance partnersâ€”enabling us to:Offer early outreach and support to help contractors secure the best-fit policies. Generate dual revenue streams through both access to carrier/expiration data and recurring commissions from successfully closed insurance opportunities. Overall, have to believe thereâ€™s a strong opportunity to leverage OCR or AI technology to scan uploaded COIs and auto-populate or update the required data fields. This would streamline the process significantly and ensure accuracy at scale.Let me know if you have any questions as you review the document.
>

column4: Control Contact Profile and Notification Settings
column8: Per-contact public/private and alert settings
column10:
[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1758207452173839)

> As a company contact, I want to manage my profile, including its visibility and communication preferences, so that I can control what information is shared and receive only the notifications that are relevant to me.
>
> A user can access and edit contact settings. A user can select which types of emails and notifications they want to receive (e.g., sales opportunities, live events, platform updates). A user can set their profile visibility to either public (shared in the company profile) or private. All changes to a user's profile and communication settings are saved and accurately reflected across the system. The back-end system uses these preferences to properly filter and deliver communications. The system is capable of syncing contact data and preferences with external platforms like HubSpot without data loss.
>
> ADD TO PARKING LOT: As we go deeper into each respective company via coaching, sales, marketing, accounts payable, etc. we have a growing number of contacts we are capturing for each of these companies. I am assuming these contacts within HubSpot will eventually make it over to Route Marketplace or vice versa. To that end, each of these contacts will have 1) unique profiles on if/when/where their contact info is shared within Route Marketplace and 2) the email notices they should/need to receive.For example, a primary sale contact for a company needs to have their information shared in the company profile although there are 2 other sales contacts within the company. that may or may not need to be listed On the reverse side each of these three sales contacts want to be alerted to sales opportunity, although the president, director of marketing, accounts payables lead will not need to get these notices although they would like to be made aware of live events we are hosting, platform updates, etc. In short lots of communications variables. Sending this feedback over as would like to make it a topic when time is right. Keep in mind we will need to consider if/when/how C&C, TJS, MHCB also play into this profile set up under TEAM PROFILE and/or individual PROFILE.

column8: Mandatory emergency contact for paid primes
column10:
## ðŸ’¡ Feature Request Idea Summary

* The core feature is to **enhance contact information capture** on Contractor profiles by adding specific, distinguishable fields for different contact needs: an **Emergency/After Hours number** and separate **Cell/Office numbers**.
* This addresses a priority request to improve critical communication channels for clients and partners.

## User Story

* As a **Contractor User**,
* I want to have **separate, designated fields for Phone, Cell, and a mandatory After Hours/Emergency number** on my profile,
* so that all necessary parties can **contact me efficiently based on urgency and time of day**, improving communication and response times for critical events.

## **Acceptance Criteria (AC)**

* The Contractor profile input form must be updated to include three distinct, separate fields for contact numbers:
  1. **After Hours/Emergency Number**
  2. **Cell (Mobile) Number**
  3. **Phone (Office/Landline) Number**
* The **After Hours/Emergency Number** field must be clearly labeled and treated as **mandatory** for Contractor completion.
* All three fields must accept and store valid phone number formats.
* The system must save and display these distinct numbers accurately on the Contractor's profile for relevant viewing parties.
* **Migration Consideration:** Existing contact data must be reviewed and handled appropriately to populate the most relevant new field (e.g., if only one number exists, it should default to the "Phone" field, leaving "Cell" and "Emergency" blank or requiring user update).

### 

[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1762296037228269)

> Contractors required to enter After Hours/Emergency Number came up on a call with 4M today.Â  This was a request submitted last month and asking we move up on list after ISSA.Â  Also, cell phone number of contacts, e.g. they should have option for Phone and Cell to enter.

column3: Cell Phone Field in Award Emails
column8: Includes cell number for immediate coordination
column10:
### Raw Request Text

> * "Cell: **WE NEED TO ADD CELL TO PLATFORM**" (Appears in both Subcontractor Awarded and Prime Awarded emails).

## The User Story

As a **Contractor (Prime or Sub)**, I want the system to **capture and display a Cell Phone number** for the primary contact in the company profile, so that the **awarded party has a direct, mobile contact method** for project coordination.

## Acceptance Criteria

* A new, optional field for **"Cell Phone"** is added to the **Company/Contact Profile** area of the platform.
* The Cell Phone number is validated to ensure it is in an **acceptable phone number format**.
* The **Award Notification email** (for both Prime and Subcontractor) displays the Cell Phone number if it is available for the respective contact.

column8: Captures # of 1099 subs + % of work subcontracted
column10:
## ðŸ’¡ Feature Request Idea Summary

* The existing **"W-2 vs 1099 Data Capture/Calculation"** needs to be updated to capture a more accurate and flexible view of a company's subcontracting utilization.
* The current **"Company Size (W-2 Employees)"** field should be made clearer by updating its header.
* The vague **"1099 Subcontracted %"** field should be replaced with **two specific, quantitative metrics** that allow Prime Contractors to better filter, assess, and engage with potential subcontractors.

## User Story

As a **Subcontractor**, 

I want to **input specific, standardized metrics** regarding my company's **W-2 employee size and 1099 subcontracting utilization**, 

so that **Prime Contractors can accurately filter and assess my company's capabilities** based on their self-performing vs. subcontracting requirements.

## Acceptance Criteria

* The header/label for the existing field tracking W-2 employee count is updated to **"Company Size (W-2 Employees)"**.
* The following new data fields are added to the company profile data capture section (replacing the current "1099 Subcontracted %" field):
  * **Number of Subcontractor (1099) Companies** (Input field for an integer/whole number).
  * **Percentage Of Work Subcontracted** (Input field for a percentage, allowing one decimal place, e.g., XX.X).
* Both new fields are **mandatory** to ensure Prime Contractors have the baseline information required for filtering.
* The system must store the data for the new fields and display them on the contractor's profile viewable by Prime Contractors.

---

[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1763990268639859)

> Based on feedback from Frank W. at The Facilities Group (they work with over 3,000 ISP - Independent Service Providers) as it pertains to the W-2 vs 1099 Data Capture/Calculation Discussion, they calculate from two angles - Revenue % and % Of Contract.Â  Revenue % is an easy to understand calculation, although while % Of Contract is easy to calculate at the Opportunity Level (can go % labor hours, % revenue, % people), when you start to roll all Opportunities and Contracts into a Company Level snapshot, the number becomes a little more gray and "what it you want it to be for the client calculation".
> Based on this feedback and other feedback collected, proposing we update the W-2 vs 1099 Data Capture/Calculation as follows:
>
> * a) For the **Company Size (W-2 Employees)** data point < suggest we update header as shown to left so clear and we still utilize and capture the current drop down range
> * b) For the **1099 Subcontracted %** < Since the feedback we are receiving is every company calculates this percentage differently, e.g. employee (individual) vs subcontractor (individual), revenue W-2 vs 1099, account count W-2 vs 1099, I suggest we capture this data with two data fields/numbers that will give the Prime's enough baseline info and insights to understand the level of subcontracting occurring with a given contractor.Â  Based on these two fields/numbers, the PRIME will be able to 1) filter in/out what they are looking for and 2) when a match is made determine if additional conversation is needed around a given opportunity, e.g. we want you to self performing this opportunity at minimum this percentage.Â  The two data fields/numbers are:
>
> > **Subcontractor Utilization Overview (Company Wide):**
>
> * **Number of Subcontractor (1099) CompaniesÂ Â Â Â Â  xx**
> * **Percentage Of Work SubcontractedÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  xx.x**Â Â Â Â

column8: Share/Download buttons; low-liability terminology
column10:
## ðŸ’¡ Feature Request Idea Summary

* The "Credentials" page needs a **user-friendly sharing and downloading mechanism** for the uploaded documents.
* The terminology used for document status and verification needs to be **de-risked** by avoiding strong terms like "VERIFIED" and "Validated," opting instead for low-liability terms like **"Exchange Received"** or **"Contractor-Provided"**.
* The **page header, labels, and instructional text** for all document uploads need to be **polished for consistency, clarity, and branding**.
* A **new call-to-action (CTA)** is required under the Insurance section to promote a complimentary review through a specific partnership.

### User Story

As a **Company Member**, I want the **"Credentials" page** to feature **low-liability, business-focused terminology** and provide **quick action links** to view, share, and download my company's uploaded documents, so that I can **efficiently manage our compliance materials** and **leverage the platform's trusted partnerships**.

## Acceptance Criteria

* **Header Updated:** The page header is updated to:

  > **Credentials** Demonstrate you are **Business Ready** by uploading the applicable documents belowâ€”building trust, strengthening credibility, and positioning your company for new opportunities.
* **Document Actions:** For each uploaded document, there are distinct, functional buttons/links for **VIEW**, **SHARE (via email link)**, and **DOWNLOAD**.
* **Verification Terminology:** All instances of strong verification terms (like "VERIFIED" or "Validated") are replaced with a low-liability term like **"Contractor-Provided"** or **"Exchange Received"** (specifically for the progress summary status).
* **Instructional Text Updates:**
  * **Business License:**
    * Label updated to: **"Upload your current business license."**
    * New Note added: **"If your company operates across multiple markets or states, please upload the active business license for the city/state where your corporate office is registered."**
  * **COI (Insurance):** Instructions updated to: **"Upload your current Certificate of Insurance."**
  * **W-9:** Instructions updated to: **"Upload your current W-9."** (Replacing "Required for 1099 reporting and payment processing.")
* **Insurance CTA:** A new section/block is added under the Insurance (COI) document upload with the following text and CTA link:

  > Interested in a complimentary review of your companyâ€™s insurance? Ensure youâ€™re properly protected, identify any potential liability gaps, and confirm youâ€™re only paying for the coverage you truly need. **Request Your Complimentary Insurance Review**

[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1763823024365619)

> CREDITIAL PAGE
>
> 1. Ability to VIEW, SHARE (email link) or DOWNLOAD from this screen, e.g. Members under this company will need quick access to it and ability to share, download, etc. (See screenshot below).
>
> 2\. Do we want to say VERIFIED (I see verified as we called and confirmed the info is valid - which is what we are working through with legal).Â  Suggest "Uploaded, Contractor-Provided,Â Â  - something with low-liability term [@Bill Basil](https://routeplatform.slack.com/team/U04TRD1NM52)
> 3. Update "Upload your license for verification" to "Upload your current business license."
> 4. Business License - Add note "If your company operates across multiple markets or states, please upload the active business license for the city/state where your corporate office is registered."
> 5.Â  Make instructions consistent across all uploads, e.g. "Provide your Certificate of Insurance" updated to "Upload your current Certificate of Insurance." and "Required for 1099 reporting and payment processing" updated to "Upload your current W-9"
> 6) In the page header, brand this more, e.g.
> **Credentials**
> Build trust with potential clients through verification
> updated to
> **Credentials**
> Demonstrate you are *Business Ready* by uploading the applicable documents belowâ€”building trust, strengthening credibility, and positioning your company for new opportunities.
> 7. Progress Summary:Â  Do we want to say Route Verification or Exchange Received (or something that is not as strong as Validated" [@Bill Basil](https://routeplatform.slack.com/team/U04TRD1NM52)
> 8. We are having some strong initial wins with our partnership with Limn Insurance, e.g. bring value both knowledge, coverage and cost.Â  As such, can we add under Insurance (COI) add the following
> "Interested in a complimentary review of your companyâ€™s insurance? Ensure youâ€™re properly protected, identify any potential liability gaps, and confirm youâ€™re only paying for the coverage you truly need. Click below to get started."
> Request Your Complimentary Insurance Review
